title: How to Invest in Rare Earth Metals? (Electio Invest)
text: By Electio Invest Oct 14, 2015 Rare earth metals have continued to be popular across the entire global market. This is particularly because of the numerous uses that are associated with them. Today, they have been used to produce a good number of high tech products as well as artillery products. They are sometimes referred to as tech metals for this cause. This also explains why a good number of people are utterly willing to invest in these metals. But, how can you venture into the business involving investments in technology metals and successfully reap your desired results? Here are some important tips.Willing to take the risks? This is the question that you should always ask yourself. Granted; investing in rare earth metals may be a good idea especially if you are dealing with companies that are fully functional and making profits. Otherwise, it is quite risky. Markets can be so volatile that it is may even be difficult to predict the state of the markets on the following day. For example, recent changes in the cost of rare earth market were caused by the nuclear power plant disaster in japan. It had a huge impact on the overall market shares in rare earth metal producing companies. The reduction was almost 10 % and it forced many investors to lose a great deal of confidence in the commodities. Based on this, it is always important to be wary of the risks involved before venturing into rare earth metal related investments.The story is not always bad. Just because the market share prices for rare earth metal investments may be volatile does not suggest that the story is always bad. There is always some light at the end of the tunnel. In order to be sure of seeing any success, you are advised to go for the most booming metals. Some rare earth metals always have market irrespective of the state of the market share prices. Therefore, investing in companies such as these is often a good idea. For example, lithium is currently among the most useful metals of this group despite the fact that it is not usually on the list of rare earth metals. Despite its wide usage in the manufacture of batteries, it is still somewhat impractical to rely heavily on lithium investments. This is mainly because of its volatility. However, investing in scandium and yttrium is often a good idea.Being on the lookout at all times is always said to be a good idea. Sometimes investing in rare earth metals may mean being expectant of share price fluctuations in different companies depending on the metals that they supply. Dealing with several rare earth producers is often a good idea. This is mainly because as prices of one rare earth metal plummet, the prices of other metals may be on a surge.Choosing between Chinese and other markets is a matter that you cannot dismiss. The chines produce up to 90 % of the rare earth metals that are available today. However, they have reduced their exports of the metals citing an increase in their local consumption. Therefore, investing in other suppliers such as the United States and certain African countries may be a good idea.
